title: How to Cast from a Chrome Browser

steps.title: Locate an empty HDMI port on your TV.
steps.content: Locate an empty HDMI port on your TV. Look behind your TV and find the HDMI ports at the back. Your TV may have multiple HDMI ports, just select one.

steps.title: Connect the Chromecast dongle to a power source.
steps.content: Connect the Chromecast dongle to a power source. Plug one end of the USB power cable into your Chromecast and the other end of the cable into the power supply and then into a nearby power outlet. The USB power cable and power adapter is included in the box. If you do not have access to an open outlet, you can also power your Chromecast by plugging the USB power cord directly into an open USB port* on your TV.

steps.title: Insert the dongle into the port.
steps.content: Insert the dongle into the port. Now, attach the dongle by inserting it into the HDMI port of your choice.

steps.title: View the HDMI display.
steps.content: View the HDMI display. Power on your TV and press the “Source” button on your TV remote. Switch to the HMDI port number you inserted your Chromecast into. Once there, you should be greeted by the Chromecast screen.

steps.title: Launch Google Chrome.
steps.content: Launch Google Chrome. On your computer, double-click its icon on your desktop to launch the browser.

steps.title: Download the Chromecast app.
steps.content: Download the Chromecast app. At this point, your TV will instruct you to visit https://www.google.com/chromecast/setup/ . Follow its advice and download the Chromecast app from the setup page.

steps.title: Go to the extension's page on the Chrome Store.
steps.content: Go to the extension's page on the Chrome Store. Before you can cast from your Chrome browser to your TV, you need the extension to be installed into your Chrome browser. To do this, head to this address: This address should take you the Chrome store link of the extension.

steps.title: Install the extension.
steps.content: Install the extension. Now all you need to do is click on the blue “Free” button on the upper-right corner of the extension description window to install it. The extension should download and install automatically after clicking.

steps.title: Launch Chromecast.
steps.content: Launch Chromecast. The Chromecast app will automatically launch; if not, click on Chromecast on your desktop to launch it.

steps.title: Check your code.
steps.content: Check your code. Both your computer and your TV will display a randomized code. Check that both are showing the same code then click “That's my code.”

steps.title: Connect to the network.
steps.content: Connect to the network. On your computer, enter your Wi-Fi's password. Here, you can name your Chromecast if you want .

steps.title: Find a tab to cast.
steps.content: Find a tab to cast. Now that the extension is operational, you can look for a tab you want to cast to your TV. This can be anything as long as it is on one tab in your computer's Chrome browser.

steps.title: Detect the Chromecast.
steps.content: Detect the Chromecast. Once you are on a tab you want to cast, press the “Cast” button on the Chrome toolbar, which is at the top-right area of the browser with the icons of the extensions you have installed. It should automatically detect the Chromecast that is connected to your TV.

steps.title: Cast from your Chrome browser.
steps.content: Cast from your Chrome browser. Select the extension once more, and it should state your Chromecast name. Click on the Chromecast name to cast the tab to your TV.
